dsDescriptionValue.value: Alfvenic-type turbulence in strongly magnetized, low-beta pair plasmas is investigated. A coupled set of equations for the evolution of the magnetic and  flow potentials are derived, covering both  fluid and kinetic scales. In the  fluid (MHD) range those equations are the same as for electron-ion plasmas, so turbulence at those scales is expected to be of the Alfvenic nature, exhibiting critical balance, dynamic alignment, and transition to a tearing mediated regime at small scales. The critical scale at which a transition to a tearing-mediated range occurs is derived, and the spectral slope in that range is predicted to be $k_\perp^{-8/3}$ (or $k_\perp^{-3}, depending on details of the reconnecting con figuration assumed). At scales below the electron (and positron) skin depth, it is argued that turbulence is dictated by a cascade of the inertial Alfven wave, which we show to result in the magnetic energy spectrum $propto k_\perp^{-11/3}$.
